issue.title: Rendering to a Image no longer works since #10520

labels.name: S-Needs-Triage
labels.description: This issue needs to be labelled

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
## Bevy version

https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/commit/44424391fe217d9b0b4b0be2649b44a994983a59

## What you did

I updated my library [bevy_smooth_pixel_camera](https://github.com/doonv/bevy_smooth_pixel_camera)  to https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/commit/44424391fe217d9b0b4b0be2649b44a994983a59 (I know that it's caused by this exact commit)

## What went wrong

The viewport texture is no longer updated unless I move my cursor or resized the window.

This means **the viewport texture is not getting updated by the world camera** (Which is supposed to render to that texture via `RenderTarget::Image`). It updates when I move my cursor because of my `update_viewport_size` system, which only runs when the `Window` is changed. This system, among other things, resizes the viewport texture with `Image::resize`. And that appears to make the texture update for some reason.

## Additional information

[Here is the source code that reproduces this issue](https://github.com/doonv/bevy_smooth_pixel_camera/blob/temp-debug-update/src/systems.rs#L134).

body:
> In both case, triggering change detection on the material / the sprite updates it

Could you elaborate on that? What exactly is going wrong and how do we fix it?
yup, that's triggering change detection on your image, and should not be needed

issue.title: Fix infinite asset preparation due to undrained AssetEvent events

labels.name: A-Rendering
labels.description: Drawing game state to the screen

labels.name: C-Performance
labels.description: A change motivated by improving speed, memory usage or compile times

labels.name: S-Ready-For-Final-Review
labels.description: This PR has been approved by the community. It's ready for a maintainer to consider merging it

repository.name: bevy
repository.description: A refreshingly simple data-driven game engine built in Rust

issue.body:
# Objective

After #10520, I was experiencing seriously degraded performance that ended up being due to never-drained `AssetEvent` events causing havoc inside `extract_render_asset::<A>`. The same events being read over and over again meant the same assets were being prepared every frame for eternity. For what it's worth, I was noticing this on a static scene about every 3rd or so time running my project.

* References #10520
* Fixes #11240

Why these events aren't sometimes drained between frames is beyond me and perhaps worthy of another investigation, but the approach in this PR effectively restores the original cached `EventReader` behavior (which fixes it).

## Solution

I followed the [`CachedSystemState` example](https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/blob/3a666cab23eab5e83552ae074f47d8663221311e/crates/bevy_ecs/src/system/function_system.rs#L155) to make sure that the `EventReader` state is cached between frames like it used to be when it was an argument of `extract_render_asset::<A>`.
